t: Joel 1
The Devastation of Locusts
The*p word of the Lord*s that came to Joel, the son of Pethuel:
Hear*pn this, O elders, And*ln listen, all inhabitants of the land. Has*ln anything*i like*i this happened in your days Or*ln in your fathersâ€™ days?
Tell*ln your sons about it, And*ln let*i your sons tell*i their sons, And*ln their sons the next generation.

What*ln the gnawing locust has left, the swarming locust has eaten; And*ln what the swarming locust has left, the creeping locust has eaten; And*ln what the creeping locust has left, the stripping locust has eaten.
Awake,*ln drunkards, and weep; And*ln wail, all you wine drinkers, On*ln account of the sweet wine That*ln is cut off from your mouth.
For*ln a nation has invaded my land, Mighty*ln and without number; Its*ln teeth are the teeth of a lion, And*ln it has the fangs of a lioness.
It*ln has made my vine a waste And*ln my fig tree splinters. It*ln has stripped them bare and cast them*i away; Their*ln branches have become white.
Wail*ln like a virgin girded with sackcloth For*ln the bridegroom of her youth.
The*ln grain offering and the drink offering are cut off From*ln the house of the Lord.*s The*ln priests mourn, The*ln ministers of the Lord.*s
The*ln field is ruined, The*ln land mourns; For*ln the grain is ruined, The*ln new wine dries up, Fresh*ln oil fails.
Be*ln ashamed, O farmers, Wail,*ln O vinedressers, For*ln the wheat and the barley; Because*ln the harvest of the field is destroyed.
The*ln vine dries up And*ln the fig tree fails; The*ln pomegranate, the palm also, and the apple tree, All*ln the trees of the field dry up. Indeed,*ln rejoicing dries up From*ln the sons of men.

Gird*ln yourselves with*i sackcloth*i And*ln lament, O priests; Wail,*ln O ministers of the altar! Come,*ln spend the night in sackcloth O*ln ministers of my God, For*ln the grain offering and the drink offering Are*ln withheld from the house of your God.
Starvation and Drought
Consecrate*pn a fast, Proclaim*ln a solemn assembly; Gather*ln the elders And*iln all the inhabitants of the land To*ln the house of the Lord*s your God, And*ln cry out to the Lord.*s
Alas*ln for the day! For*ln the day of the Lord*s is near, And*ln it will come as destruction from the Almighty.
Has*ln not food been cut off before our eyes, Gladness*ln and joy from the house of our God?
The*ln seeds shrivel under their clods; The*ln storehouses are desolate, The*ln barns are torn down, For*ln the grain is dried up.
How*ln the beasts groan! The*ln herds of cattle wander aimlessly Because*ln there is no pasture for them; Even*ln the flocks of sheep suffer.
To*ln You, O Lord,*s I cry; For*ln fire has devoured the pastures of the wilderness And*ln the flame has burned up all the trees of the field.
Even*ln the beasts of the field pant for You; For*ln the water brooks are dried up And*ln fire has devoured the pastures of the wilderness.
